data.title: If you like Menudo.. this is the place to go!!
data.text: I haven't eaten anything other than menudo here. However this is the freshest, non smelling, tasty menudo I've ever had to this day. Its clean and the meat is cooked thoroughly. I cant say enough good things about this meal. They have good horchata  (rice drink) and the coffee is good too.

data.title: Margarita Happy Hour
data.text: Best Mexican restaurant around. The service,atmosphere, and prices are just great.The staff are superb and speak both English and Spanish fluently so no problem ordering your meal of choice.On Sundays they have a Trio that plays for a few hours and every day they have Happy Hour from 4-7. You have to try their Margarita's they are just the best and at two for the price of one during Happy Hour you can't go wrong. Try their Chicken Mole I guarantee you will love it.

data.title: Fresh Flavors
data.text: Amazing Fajitas!.  Order them traditional with NO BROCCOLI!  What the hell???  Broccoli?  A side of beans is always a good addition to use with their fresh chips...

data.title: Mexican Food...YUM!
data.text: This place is great and authentic Mexican food. I love this place not only for the food but the hours. They stay open late plus they deliver.

data.title: A nice stop for a quick lunch
data.text: It won't kill your pocketbook and it's a pleasant, family restaurant with authentic Mexican food. A place to return to because you'll have a hard time tasting their whole menu.

data.title: Authentic Mexican food, with friendly staff
data.text:
This was our first visit to Casa Adelita. We tried it because of the high ratings on Trip Advisor. We were really pleased.
The place was packed and the food was very good. We had taquitos- good sized and had lean meat. The house margaritas were large and well made.
Our waitress was attentive and brought spicy salsa when she found out we liked it. 
Give it a try!🌮

data.title: authentic mexican food
data.text: Try the steak Mexicana.  its tasty/spicy but not overly done.  Food I always served perfectly hot and fresh

data.title: Greatest Happy Hour!
data.text: It would be hard to beat the authenticity of the Tacos Al Pastor.  And where else would you find Bohemia AND Negra Modelo ?  It is surely crowd pleasing.  The staff are extremely friendly and the restaurant is always very clean.

data.title: Better than Adelita's in TJ
data.text:
Free unlimited warm chips and fresh salsa when you walk in. An incredible dinner specials menu and a full bar. Everything is affordable and the booths are extremely comfortable. What's not to love? 

This is my go to late night Mexican spot when I'm in the area. Everything I've ordered has been excellent. I especially like the birria (goat) and Tampiquena (beef). If you're feeling somthing lighter, go for the caldo de res (soup). The waitresses are friendly and accomodating. I drink like a horse and the staff is always there to fill me up. The mural on the wall is beautiful and very detailed, they took extra care to make sure it was anatomically correct.

data.title: never fails to please
data.text:
Casa Adelita 3 never fails to please with great Mexican food at their La Habra location.  It reminds me of a "Mexican Denny's/Norms", with their all day/night breakfast (and restaurant booths), with other upgrade entrees like their Mocahete, desserts, and full bar selection.  The place might look small, but they have another big room next door, so it's actually great for groups.

I've been coming to this spot for years, usually for late night eats, and I don't think I've ever ordered anything here that I didn't like.  Everything is pretty delicious, has homemade flavor, and reasonably priced. I also appreciate their various hot sauces, placed on each table.

Service is usually pretty good here.  On certain days, particularly the weekend, they have mariachi entertainment, giving it that "in Mexico" feeling.

The restaurant is located in a not so great area of La Habra.  If you're unlucky, you might get a tweaker gang member hitting you up in the parking lot (happened to me).  But don't worry too much...

I've also been to the other Casa Adelita, in Norwalk, which is good too.  The ambiance there is not as homey, but it's another great spot with the same great dishes.

data.title: Breakfast was OK.  Service slower than expected.  More expensive than food quality.
data.text:
Our family of 3 tried a Sunday morning breakfast there.  It took about 20 minutes to get our food.

2 adult breakfasts, 1 kids meal, 1 OJ, and 1 coffee was $40 (Before tip).

Chilachiles was ok.  I got the green sauce, but it did not have enough spice.  The red sauce was better.

My husband says the menudo was OK, as well.

My son got the kids meal with pancake, eggs, and bacon.  The pancake had good flavor, but over cooked on the edges.

We are not likely to rush back for breakfast, but I would try it again for lunch or dinner.  The place was quite busy...so maybe we just ordered the wrong items.

data.title: I love this restaurant
data.text: It's definitely not fancy but I love it.  I love the nice sweet waitresses.  The taquitos are what I usually order.  For $8.95 you get two good sized taquitos, rice and beans.  Actually best homemade taquitos I've everhad.  I had the carne asada with shrimp (prepared any way you like) rice, and beans the other night for about $15.95.  The shrimp al mojo de ajo ( garlic and butter) are delicious.  The happy hour is great.  $3.00 margaritas from 5-7 weeknights.  It's just an awesome place to go for a night out when you just don't want to cook.  They do not offer tortilla soup which is too bad.  They have a full bar.  I would highly reccommend this place if your not looking for a fancy restaurant.

data.title: Our favorite 'local' place
data.text: For us, Mexican food doesn't get any better than at Casa Adelita!  My favorite is a canitas wet burrito.  So much food!  We also like the hard shell beef tacos plate.  Everything is so good!

data.title: Hometown  restaurant
data.text: Friendly service.   Nice breakfast.  Nothing special but tasted good.  The new owner of a long-time family owned business here in town is very friendly and wants to become a favorite.  Chips and salsa come with each meal, even breakfast.

data.title: Good old fashioned Mexican food served piping hot
data.text:
My wife and I have been dining at Adelita's for a couple of years now. This is a tipycal small restaurant with no view or outdoor seating and is located in the old part of La Habra.
The food is typical old fashioned Mexican food and it is always served very hot. We enjoy the food every time we eat here. There is a large selection, the $3 margaritas are delicious and the $3 shrimp  ceviche tostada is the best ceviche I have ever had anywhere, even the fancy restaurants. You can't go wrong eating here. The staff knows what they are doing and most of them have worked here a long time.
I had the owner cater an outdoor event for about 50 people last year and he did a great job, everyone was please.
So skip the non authentic expensive Mexican restaurants and dine here, you will not be disappointed.

user_location.name: La Habra Heights, California, United States

data.title: Love Casa Adelita!!!
data.text: Started going there a few years ago before they had a bar.  Now that they have a full bar...even better!!!  Super reasonable prices.  Favorite of the locals of all nationalities.  great mexican seafood as well as great Mexican combinations.  Friendly service.  Nothing fancy but a must try!!!

data.title: Mas o menos
data.text:
La comida no es muy rica, excepto  las hamburguesas. Los precios estan relativamente buenos pero no esta bien que la misma persona que atiende las mesas, cuente el dinero en una de los mesones donde se presentan los platos.
Los jugos naturales son buenos!
